no_more_50_words: Universities commonly offer a "communications" major, and because students need to take relevant classes to complete their major, many classes on the subject take place at universities.
150_to_200_words: Billy might be taking his communications course at a university. Universities provide the opportunity to take classes in a variety of subjects and are the most common place to find courses in communications. Universities offer courses in communications that cover topics such as media production, public speaking, writing, and communication theory. Universities also provide access to specialized courses that focus on a particular aspect of communications. This allows students to gain a more in-depth understanding of the subject and to gain the skills needed to succeed in the field. Taking courses at a university also allows students to take advantage of the resources available at the university, such as libraries, laboratories, and faculty advisors. Finally, universities provide access to a variety of networking opportunities that can help students find internships and jobs in the communications field.
